availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Dowd (Harrison County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza J. Shingleton Dowd in Harrison County, Kentucky, on February 13, 1856. Father of James A. Dowd, Oden Smith Dowd, Imogene Dowd, George E. Dowd, Cora W. Dowd, and Lilly T. Dowd. Laborer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 164A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 415.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 468.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Casons, p. 117A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994037, Harrison County Marriages, p. 443.
"John J Doud (1823-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial 126726174, accessed January 30 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126726174.
